result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Lee Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 05-01-2016 or serve 16 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  To be paid as part of payment plan on fine.

To be completed within 9 months.  To be monitored through WCS.  Part of the Community Service to benefit law enforcement.

6/22/2017 - COURT GRANTS 6 MONTH COMMUNITY SERVICE EXTENSION.   PENALTY FOR NON-COMPLETION IS 30 DAYS JAIL, STRAIGHT TIME, CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

12/22/2017 - COURT GRANTS AN ADDITIONAL 2 MONTH EXTENSION TO COMPLETE COMMUNTIY SERVICE.

records.addlTxt: Verified with the Jail - Defendant served the 20 days straight-time for failure to complete the community service back on 04/17/18 - 05/02/18.

Filed by Atty. Martinez -  Informing the court the defendant was arrested on this warrant and sat in custody from 04/17/18 - 05/02/18 as a penalty for the failure to complete the community service hours.

09/18/19 - Court Reviewed - Time Served Verified with the Jail - Warrant to be Quashes and Case to be removed from the calendar.
Bail/bond hearing on September 19, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

For non completion of community service.
Defendant to serve 20 days straight time.

WCS CSO Non-Compliance
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 2/24/18; Capias and must serve 20 days straight time.**

From WCS dated 12/20/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service.
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 12/22/17; 2 month extension granted.**

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Return of correspondence from Clerk dated 6/27/17.
To defendant, due date calculated in error, please work with WCS to complete hours within the extension granted.
Letter mailed to defendant, advising of 6-month extension to complete community service, proof due by 5/19/18

From WCS dated 6/20/17 re defendant's failure to complete community service and informing Court that defendant advised her atty plans to request extension. Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian, 6 month extension granted.
Review hearing on June 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michelle Lee Garcia in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the Defendant's completion of community service.   Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant has not completed any of the community service and requests an extension to complete the community service and that the Court order additional community service to satisfy the fine.  The Court grants the request and the Defendant is to complete 56 hours community service within 6 months and the costs will amend joc to waive fine/costs, failure to comply, 20 days jail as penalty for non completion.  Review hearing scheduled for June 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on December 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

From WCS dated 11/21/16 re defendant's non compliance with completion of community service.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 11/22/16; Schedule hearing and provide notice to defendant.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michelle Lee Garcia in court with attorney Daniel McMurray for Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #4:
FINE: $568.00 (to pay $25.00 per month commencing 5/1/16, 16 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment)
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid as part of payment plan on fine).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 50 hours community service within 9 months, to be monitored through WCS (part of community service to benefit law enforcement).
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-19-2016 10:00 am

Attorney Nicholas Martinez  Attorney appears by authorization for Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Michelle Lee Garcia did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez has received discovery and an offer and requests the matter be set for plea and sentencing. Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Michelle Lee Garcia did not appear.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing at 02-05-2016 08:30 am

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Parties (Lamar Thomas) and Defendant are not to reside together while the case is pending.

Defendant Michelle Lee Garcia in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
